documents: Spaying and neutering pets can prevent certain cancers and behavioral problems. It's typically recommended between 4-6 months of age for most pets.
Fleas and ticks can cause skin irritation, anemia, and transmit diseases. Regular prevention is important, especially during peak seasons.
Ear infections in pets are often caused by bacteria, yeast, or ear mites. Signs include scratching at ears, head shaking, and foul odor. Treatment depends on the underlying cause.
Arthritis is common in older pets and can cause pain, stiffness, and difficulty moving. Treatment options include pain medication, supplements, and physical therapy.
